About Me:

My name is Nick Murrin and I am a Computer Science graduate of California State University San Marcos. I also have a certification in web development, specifically in Full Stack Web Developement. My current expertise is in Front End Web Development. I take pride in my work, and I am always available to help people with their websites.

Project 1: Education Station

Description: An educational website that reinforces early education for younger kids.

Languages/frameworks used:

  • Javascript (Vanilla JS)
  • Bootstrap

Software used:

  • Notepad ++
Education Station

Project 2: Zen Station

Description: A relaxing website that allows users to settle down by living in the moment through various forms of enlightenment. (formally known as Zen Center, but now remastered in Next JS)

Languages/frameworks used:

  • Javascript(Vanilla JS)
  • Next JS (routing)
  • Bootstrap (UI/UX)

Software used:

  • VS Code
Zen Station

Project 3: NaviSmart Group App

Description: A web-based application for college aged people who wishes to boost their productivity in the morning.

Languages/frameworks used:

  • React.JS(with Redux)
  • Node.JS
  • Javascript
  • Mongo DB
  • Express.JS

Software used:

  • VS Code
  • Heroku (deployment)
  • Trello (orgainization)
Team Project on NaviSmart

Project 5: GoldenCities: Mobile Application

Description: Made for the user to look up a city where he/she wants to go by first selecting a continent and a popular city from that continent.

Languages/frameworks used:

  • C#
  • Xamarian Forms

Software used:

  • Xcode
Golden Cities

Project 6: Python Mini Programs

Description: A series of three Python projects to refresh on my Python skills, attached with screenshots.

  • Part A: Dice Facts: randomly generates a number between 1 and 9 to roll a dice, and each number has a fact about that number.
  • Part B: Madlibs: ask users to enter a series of inputs for each type of word that will be considered as a Mad Lib to finish the story.

Software used:

  • Xcode
Golden Cities
